subject: Learning
title: Flashbulb Memories
description: A micro-lesson that makes Flashbulb Memories usable.

hook.text: You remember exactly where you were when you heard shocking news. Every detail feels vivid.

buildup.text: Flashbulb memories are snapshots of high-emotion moments: clear, detailed, confident.

discovery.text: The amygdala tags emotional events as important, boosting encoding strength dramatically.

twist.text: But research shows flashbulb memories are just as inaccurate as ordinary ones. We just feel more certain.

climax.text: Emotion doesn't improve accuracy. It improves confidence‚Äîa dangerous combination.

quiz.question: What makes flashbulb memories misleading?
options: They feel vivid but are often inaccurate
